title: How to Make Reduced Fat French Fries in 20 Minutes

steps.headline: Wash (and peel, if you prefer) enough potatoes for everyone eating.
steps.description: Use 2 medium potatoes (smaller than your fist) per person.

steps.headline: Slice each potato to about 1/4" thickness.
steps.description: You can slice whichever way, depending on what length of fry you like. Then cut each slice into french fry shape.

steps.headline: Grease the sheet with cooking spray, and arrange potatoes in a single layer.
Spray the tops of the potatoes with butter spray.
steps.description: You could also use Pam; it will have less flavor but will do the trick.

steps.headline: Use your favorite spices over the fries.
steps.description: Some recommended spices are garlic salt, paprika, chili powder, and black pepper, but you can use whatever tastes best to you. Remember, more seasoning = more potent taste, so be careful.

steps.headline: Put the pan in the oven (middle or higher), and turn to "Broil" for approximately 10-13 minutes.
steps.description: Watch for the tops to become crispy brown, but not burnt.

steps.headline: Remove pan from the oven, and turn potatoes over.
Put potatoes back in oven, broil for another 6-8 minutes, or until the other side is crispy and brown.
Serve immediately.
steps.description: For added bonus, put some shredded cheddar cheese on top after you plate the potatoes, but this is unhealthy for you!

text: Wash (and peel, if you prefer) enough potatoes for everyone eating. Use 2 medium potatoes (smaller than your fist) per person. Slice each potato to about 1/4" thickness. You can slice whichever way, depending on what length of fry you like. Then cut each slice into french fry shape. Grease the sheet with cooking spray, and arrange potatoes in a single layer.  Spray the tops of the potatoes with butter spray. You could also use Pam; it will have less flavor but will do the trick. Use your favorite spices over the fries. Some recommended spices are garlic salt, paprika, chili powder, and black pepper, but you can use whatever tastes best to you. Remember, more seasoning = more potent taste, so be careful. Put the pan in the oven (middle or higher), and turn to "Broil" for approximately 10-13 minutes. Watch for the tops to become crispy brown, but not burnt. Remove pan from the oven, and turn potatoes over. Caution: Pan is very hot! Put potatoes back in oven, broil for another 6-8 minutes, or until the other side is crispy and brown.  Serve immediately. For added bonus, put some shredded cheddar cheese on top after you plate the potatoes, but this is unhealthy for you!
